intro: Collomia nudicaulis, commonly known as the naked stalked bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its simple, hairy stems and showy blue to purple bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, often in mountainous regions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Collomia nudicaulis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or dry areas.
